name: Pen y Fan via Storey Arms
description: The 'Motorway' route. Most popular and easiest way to the highest peak in South Wales. Well surfaced path but steep. Very busy on weekends.

name: Pen y Fan via Pont ar Daf
description: Slightly shorter alternative starting from the main car park. Merges with Storey Arms path. Good wide path suitable for most abilities (but still a mountain).

name: Pen y Fan Horseshoe
description: The classic horseshoe route from Cwm Gwdi. Ascends Cribyn, Pen y Fan, Corn Du. Much quieter and more scenic than the main tourist tracks.

name: Corn Du & Pen y Fan Circular
description: Circular loop taking in both main peaks. Go up Corn Du first for dramatic reveal of Pen y Fan. Descent via main path.

name: Fan y Big via The Gap
description: Route to the famous 'Diving Board' rock. Uses the Roman Road (The Gap). Less crowded. Great views of the main peaks.

name: Fan Brycheiniog & Llyn y Fan Fach
description: Spectacular walk in the Black Mountain range (western Brecons). Visit the legendary 'Lady of the Lake'. Dramatic escarpment walking.

name: The Carmarthen Fans (Picws Du)
description: Extended loop taking in Fan Brycheiniog, Picws Du and Fan Foel. One of the finest ridge walks in Wales. Wild and remote feel.

name: Four Falls Trail
description: Famous waterfall walk visiting Sgwd Clun-Gwyn, Sgwd Isaf Clun-Gwyn, Sgwd y Pannwr, and Sgwd yr Eira (where you can walk behind the falls).

name: Elidir Trail (Waterfall Country)
description: Scenic riverside walk from Pontneddfechan. Passes multiple waterfalls including Sgwd Gwladus. Mythical 'Fairy Glen' atmosphere.

name: Sugar Loaf
description: Iconic conical peak near Abergavenny. Gentle ascent with massive views. Great for families and sunset walks.

name: The Skirrid (Skirrid Fawr)
description: The 'Holy Mountain'. Steep initial climb through woods then open ridge. Famous for its landslide scar and ruined chapel on summit.

name: The Blorenge
description: Diverse walk overlooking Abergavenny. Takes in the Keeper's Pond, industrial heritage, and open moorland. Great views of Sugar Loaf.

name: Table Mountain (Crug Hywel)
description: Start from Crickhowell village. Climb to the flat-topped summit with Iron Age hillfort. Stunning views over Usk Valley.

name: Hay Bluff
description: Prominent bluff overlooking Hay-on-Wye. Steep start then flat ridge. Often combined with Twmpa.

name: Twmpa (Lord Hereford's Knob)
description: Opposite Hay Bluff across Gospel Pass. Great views into the secluded valleys. Can be done with Hay Bluff for a longer day.

name: Waun Fach & The Dragon's Back
description: Highest peak in the Black Mountains. Ascend via the undulating 'Dragon's Back' ridge from Pengenffordd. Classic route.

name: Craig Cerrig Gleisiad
description: Nature reserve with dramatic glacial cwm. Great alternative to Pen y Fan. Rich in wildflowers and birdlife (Ring Ouzel).

name: Henrhyd Falls & Nant Llech
description: Visit South Wales' highest waterfall (Batcave location). Walk down the Nant Llech valley for a peaceful woodland stroll.

name: Llyn y Fan Fawr
description: The larger, wilder lake. Start from Tafarn-y-Garreg. Steep climb up to the escarpment. Very remote feel.

name: Tor y Foel
description: Overlooks Talybont Reservoir. Mix of canal towpath, woodland, and open hill. Panoramic views from summit.

name: Ysgyryd Fach (Little Skirrid)
description: The smaller neighbour to the Skirrid. Gentle walk with nice views over Abergavenny. Good for a quick stretch.

name: Fan Gyhirych
description: Lesser known peak in Fforest Fawr. Great views of the Fans. Interesting geology and sinkholes.

name: Pen y Crug
description: Short walk from Brecon town. Iron Age hillfort with commanding views of the central Beacons.

name: Talybont Reservoir Walk
description: Flat walk along the old railway line/forestry track beside the reservoir. Great for families and buggies.

name: Llanthony Priory Circular
description: Start at the stunning priory ruins. Climb the valley sides for views of the Black Mountains. Finish with a drink in the cellar bar.
